body:
**What happened**:

Kops runs `kube-proxy` from a pod manifest stored on the node, having the `scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod` annotation.

We've experienced the case where the cluster autoscaler turned on a new node and, once the node has been added to the cluster, application pods have been admitted before `kube-proxy`. Once it was the turn of `kube-proxy`, all system resources were utilized, so the pod has not been regularly admitted.

However, since it's a critical pod, the `kubelet` executed the `HandleAdmissionFailure`, which has tried to kill (`killPodNow`)  a pod whose container wasn't started yet (it was downloading the Docker image), which has caused `killPodNow` to timeout and return the error `"timeout waiting to kill pod"`.

The admission of `kube-proxy` failed with the following error:
```
Unexpected error while attempting to recover from admission failure: preemption: pod worker-async-ad-stitching-tracking-5f89bb489d-mvdq4_www(829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c) failed to evict timeout waiting to kill pod
```

The `kube-proxy` pod execution has not been retried, so we've got a node without `kube-proxy` running and its networking broken.


**What you expected to happen**:

The `kube-proxy` should be eventually admitted.


**Anything else we need to know?**:

A minimal log extraction for comprehension:

```
14:27:17.909755 kubelet.go:1833] SyncLoop (ADD, "api"): "worker-async-ad-stitching-tracking-5f89bb489d-mvdq4_www(829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c)"
14:27:27.318348 kubelet.go:1833] SyncLoop (ADD, "file"): "kube-proxy-ip-REDACTED.eu-west-1.compute.internal_kube-system(a1808f36adc75b3585b0951a00ac3102)"
14:27:42.456247 predicate.go:107] Failed to admit pod kube-proxy-ip-REDACTED.eu-west-1.compute.internal_kube-system(a1808f36adc75b3585b0951a00ac3102) - Unexpected error while attempting to recover from admission failure: preemption: pod worker-async-ad-stitching-tracking-5f89bb489d-mvdq4_www(829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c) failed to evict timeout waiting to kill pod
14:27:42.479469 kubelet.go:1878] SyncLoop (PLEG): "worker-async-ad-stitching-tracking-5f89bb489d-mvdq4_www(829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c)", event: &pleg.PodLifecycleEvent{ID:"829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c", Type:"ContainerStarted", Data:"6721ad58d43a97348b00dbca545df21da98242315bcd74740331964d828adb67"}
14:28:17.000000 kubelet.go:1878] SyncLoop (PLEG): "worker-async-ad-stitching-tracking-5f89bb489d-mvdq4_www(829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c)", event: &pleg.PodLifecycleEvent{ID:"829b7759-7c9d-11e9-ac16-06903246ae0c", Type:"ContainerStarted", Data:"4725d1fbeb24e46b13d3a19290b61929f4cb14cb4398ee455b3f1ffa8a7cbc17"}
```

From the "Failed to admit pod" log I have been able to trace back the core code involved:

- `HandleAdmissionFailure` (`pkg/kubelet/preemption.go`)
  Logs: "Failed to admit pod [POD] - [ERROR]"
  - `evictPodsToFreeRequests` (`pkg/kubelet/preemption.go`)
    Error message: "preemption: pod [POD] failed to evict [ERROR]"
    - `getPodsToPreempt` (`pkg/kubelet/preemption.go`)
    - `killPodFunc` -> `killPodNow` (`pkg/kubelet/pod_workers.go`)
      Error message: "timeout waiting to kill pod"


**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version: `1.11.7`
- Cloud provider: AWS
- OS: ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS (Xenial Xerus)
- Kernel: `Linux 4.4.0-1083-aws`
- Install tools: kops
- Network plugin and version: kubenet

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

title: Failed to admit critical pod due to "timeout waiting to kill pod" while handling admission failure
